intro: Aristogeitonia, commonly known as the arrowleaf tree, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its palmate leaves, which are typically divided into three to five lobes resembling an arrowhead. The flowers are usually clustered in dense inflorescences and are often pink or purple in color. The genus is native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. Aristogeitonia species are valued for their ornamental value and are sometimes used in traditional medicine.
